availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident. Indiana native. Son of Samuel A. T. Woolfolk and Caroline Woolfolk. Married to Amanda Woolfolk in Paducah, Kentucky, on August 18, 1851. Father of Henry C. Woolfolk, Mary E. Woolfolk, Robert L. Woolfolk, Carrie Woolfolk, Lewis Woolfolk, Jennie Woolfolk, Mollie Woolfolk. Bookkeeper in Louisville in 1850. Furniture store keeper in Louisville in 1860. Juror on the trial of William Schofield (Bennett) in Louisville, Kentucky, on November 2, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 2, p. 151B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 117.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 56B.

“Capt. Woolfolk Dead,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), June 13, 1885, p. 3.
KYR-0001-004-0308.
